Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's 4:30 in the morning. Do you know where your kids are? If you are Ryan's parents or Pam's parents or my parents, you do. They're gonna be in this van. With me. Who am I? Nothing to fear. I am just a 44 year old guy with a paper route.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [honking horn] Time to make the donuts. [laughs and drives away as Ryan tries to get in the van] Come on. Whoa! No, I promise I won't do it again. Come on. [does it again] De-nied!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: We've been making 5:00 AM deliveries for a couple weeks now. Ever since I've gotten clean there's something about fresh morning air that... just really makes me sick.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hello! Time to make the donuts! Oh, Halpert! Whoa! Boner patrol. Arrest that man! Your donuts make me go nuts! [laughs] Hey Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We got the van at a used car lot. We think it says "Alleluia Church of Scranton." in Korean. It was either this or an old school bus with an owl living in it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You didn't happen to bring any coffee, did you, Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Milk and sugar.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, awesome. You're a life saver. [drinks from coffee cup] Wait, is this just milk and sugar?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's what I said.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Do you drink this every day?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Every morning.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We're, uh, we're doing okay. A couple weeks in and, um, we're having fun. Uh, yep. We have 20- of those.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [an Asian lady tries to enter the van] Oh, oh, excuse me! Sorry. Sorry, no. It's, uh, it's a paper company now. It's not for the church.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Okay, who covers Bans Pet Grooming?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, they're my client.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: No, they were your client. They just called and told us they're switching over to Michael Scott Paper Company.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [sighs] Shame, Jim. I expected more.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: In the last month we have lost ten major clients to Michael Scott.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: What are we supposed to do? They keep undercutting us on price.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: I don't want to hear excuses. I want to see improvements. This is unacceptable.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey, Boss. Uh, I'd just like to point out that I have been here less time than these guys.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Why are you telling me this?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I just think the bar should be lower for a newbie.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Is this something you really want to have said?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I don't want to have said that. But I think it's important that you know it.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: I don't know what to do to inspire these people. Okay, maybe it's my fault-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's not your fault. Some people just don't want to be inspired.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: I wrote a memo to all departments asking them to find ways to save money but, uh-

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Charles, I got your memo. Thank you. I want you to know I'm putting my foot down when it comes to expense reports. Waste not, want not.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Uh, well said, Angela.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Been there, done that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what we need? We need some couches in here.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Michael, we should really consider getting a delivery guy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, you know what you would love? Is if we built a loft.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Why would I love that? Can we afford a delivery guy?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Like in a dorm room. You put your desk underneath, you have your loft up top. You can sleep up top.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, I know what a loft is.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Most dorm rooms don't even have that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Most do in the magazines.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Let's see what a delivery guy costs.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We should look into that. Or we just go for the loft.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: Would you let Charles know that David is here, please? Jim, hey.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, David.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: David Wallace! Hello, we've been expecting you, David Wallace. Charles and I were waiting for you.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: There he is. There he is. How was the trip up?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: A lot better than a month at the Scranton Radisson, I'm sure.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Oh, you know it hasn't been that bad. Hasn't been that bad. These people are the salt of the earth down here. You couldn't ask for a better way to learn a company.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Hmmm.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: I feel like I should be thanking you.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Uh.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [makes kissing, puckering sound]

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: The conference room is ready if we want to get started.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: You know, I just want to address everyone first.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Oh yeah, take your time. Stanley, pay attention.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Hi, everyone.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Hi. Uh, look it's no secret-

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Hello. Uh, it is no secret that Michael Scott Paper has siphoned off a large chunk of our core business. And I'm here- I just want to assure everyone that we think this is just a temporary setback.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Right.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Okay?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Maybe, and I don't know, if you had just returned Michael's call none of us would've lost clients.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: I've been wondering that myself lately. We're just gonna get started, we're gonna figure this out. Rest assured. Jim, can you come in with us please?

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Uh, Jim hold on. [whispers] You know, David, uh, Dwight's been my guy. Okay?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Yeah, Jim-

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: I find that extraordinarily surprising.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: He shows promise and Jim, I don't know- I- he's been a disappointment.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: We'll bring them both in.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Okay, great. Uh, Dwight come on in. Also, Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Come along, afterthought.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: How much can we afford to pay a delivery guy?

Quote.Speaker: Financial Guy
Quote.Text: Well, if these numbers you gave me are correct-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: They are correct, sir.

Quote.Speaker: Financial Guy
Quote.Text: Then you can't afford to pay him anything.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. A lame attempt at humor. Swing and a miss.

Quote.Speaker: Financial Guy
Quote.Text: Your prices are too low.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Lowest in town.

Quote.Speaker: Financial Guy
Quote.Text: Why do you think Staples and Dunder Mifflin can't match your prices?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Corporate greed?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Look, our price model is fine. I reviewed the numbers myself. Over time with enough volume, we become profitable.

Quote.Speaker: Financial Guy
Quote.Text: Yeah, with a fixed cost pricing model that's correct.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Financial Guy
Quote.Text: But you need to use a variable cost pricing model.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, sure. Right, so- why don't you explain what that is to- so that they can under- just explain what that is.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Explain what you think that is.

Quote.Speaker: Financial Guy
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Explain that.

Quote.Speaker: Financial Guy
Quote.Text: As you sell more paper and your company grows, so will your costs. For example, delivery man, health care...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, we don't-

Quote.Speaker: Financial Guy
Quote.Text: ...business expansion-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Whatever, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Financial Guy
Quote.Text: At these prices, the more paper you sell, the less money you'll make.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Our prices are the only thing keeping us in business.

Quote.Speaker: Financial Guy
Quote.Text: They're actually putting you out of business.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, okay. Hold on, hold on. Ty, I would like you to crunch those numbers again.

Quote.Speaker: Ty
Quote.Text: It's a program. There's no such thing-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just crunch 'em. Just crunch 'em please.

Quote.Speaker: Ty
Quote.Text: [presses key on computer] Crunch.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Did it help?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hi, Jerry. Michael Scott. Well, this is slightly embarrassing. [laughs] Um, I'm going to have to... ask you to pay me a little bit more money for that delivery we dropped off yesterday. Yeah. We did. We got the check, but we're just going to need a much, much bigger check.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: When a child gets behind the wheel of a car and runs into a tree, You don't blame the child. He didn't know any better. You blame the 30-year-old woman who got in the passenger seat and said, "Drive, kid. I trust you."

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Now, would corporate approve a temporary price reduction for returning customers?

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: God, no.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Stupid. Yeah, makes us look weak.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: I agree.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I say we fill Michael's office with bees. My apiarist owes me a favor.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Really? Does he do good work or-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [scoffs] No, Jim. I use a bad apiarist. [sighs]

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Fellas, why don't we take a five-minute break and then we will come back, start fresh, sort this out.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Five minutes exactly.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Okay. Hey, Dwight. Can I talk to you?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Sure thing.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [opens phone] Hey. I saw you called.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You're just out of business?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We have maybe a month. I don't know what I'm gonna do.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah, well don't worry about it. We'll figure it out. We'll be okay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That's what Michael said.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah. Only this time we will be okay. [cell phone rings; Dwight's voice saying "Idiot, Idiot, Idiot"] Oh, that's my new "Dwight" ring.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I like it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Good, right? Hello.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [over phone] Idiot, we're starting back up. This is Dwight, by the way.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, okay. [kisses Pam] Don't worry about it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Did I ever tell you about the day that Steve Martin died?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Steve Martin's not dead, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know. But I always thought that the day that he died would be the worst day of my life. I was wrong. It's this.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You want to hear something sad?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I would love that.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So Jim and I are getting married and the wedding's really expensive. So I tried to get a job on the weekends to earn extra money. I applied to Old Navy, Target and Wal-mart. None of 'em called me back. Not even for an interview.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I never went to Thailand.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I went to Fort Lauderdale.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Was it nice?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah, it was amazing. There was a great Pad Thai place, though.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I love Pad Thai.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: You've never had Pad Thai.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. There's a lot I haven't done.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Now, this is the projection over three months?

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: We still have the inventory sitting- [everyone starts chattering at once]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Let me float something out there, okay? Can I just say- can I say something?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Yeah, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: There is a hive of bees outside the front door. We kidnap the queen, extract her alarm pheromones, place them on a flushable wipe, put that in his bathroom.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: I can't believe I'm about to say this, but the cheapest option... is to make Michael an offer.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Yes. Yes, I was gonna say the same thing. We should buy him out.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, but you didn't.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh, Man! If only Michael had children. That's how you really apply the pressure.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: What is wrong with you?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Jim, you're- you're pretty close with him. You think they'd be up for hearing an offer?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, I don't know. You know, they've taken a good deal of clients, so-

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I mean I guess- I guess I could go down there and try to nudge them in the right direction.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You know what? Why don't I do it, okay? Michael adores me. I'm the man for this job. Charles, you got my back on this?

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: No, Jim... I think you should go.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, so I'll be back in, um- back in a bit.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [knocking on door] Hmm?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, can I talk to you guys for a second?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We're not hiring, Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Actually here for something else.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Listen, I can't make you laugh right now.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know I love a good guessing game, but why don't I just tell you what I'm here for? Turns out you guys have made a pretty big dent in the Dunder Mifflin sales.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Oh, that's nice.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: David Wallace has asked me to come down here and see if you would be interested in Dunder Mifflin buying you out.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Seriously? Are you being serious?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: He's bluffing, Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Jim, what you don't understand is that this company's worthl-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No- We don't have-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh! See I'm here to learn as little information as possible. All I really need to hear is if your incredibly successful company would be receptive to a buyout.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [stammers] Uh... Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Maybe.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Three yeses. I will see you titans of industry upstairs.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, well, we're not only tight-ends, we are also quarterbacks.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Missed the last part.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's a pun.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Got it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yep. Oh... wow.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Okay, so you are not going to reveal in any way that we're broke.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Of course not.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: That we're having any problem at all.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nope, nope, nope.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Just to reiterate, none of us is going to say anything that might indicate that we are going broke.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Right, right. There is no way in hell that I am going to say that we're broke.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, I'm really worried that I'm going to say it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ah...

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: No, man. You're- you're fine.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We have to come from a position of strength.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm good, I'm good.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Just put it out of your mind.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It is. I'm good.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hello.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Michael Scott Paper Company to see Mr. David Wallace. I believe we're expected. [David and Charles walk out of conference room] Well, well, well. How the turntables...

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Michael, in order to expedite these negotiations, we are prepared to make you a very generous offer.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And we are prepared to reject that offer.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Michael, you haven't even heard-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Never accept their first offer. What is your second offer?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Are you kidding me? That is insultingly low. I don't even want to hear what your first offer was.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: What do you hear?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [mumbles]

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Here's the situation. Your company is four weeks old. I know this business. I know what suppliers are charging. I know you can't be making very much money. I don't know how your prices are so low, but I know it can't keep up that way. I'm sure you're scared. Probably in debt. This is the best offer you're gonna get.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'll see your situation and I'll raise you a situation. Your company is losing clients left and right. You have a stockholder meeting coming up and you're going to have to explain to them why your most profitable branch is bleeding. So they may be looking for a little change in the CFO. So I don't think I need to wait out Dunder Mifflin. I think I just have to wait out you.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Okay, now I don't know that I can get this. I do have to go to the board for approval. How's about $60,000. Hmm? $60,0000. Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [stutters] We'll have to talk-

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: We'll have to talk about this.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just amongst ourselves.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Okay, yes. Please take the room. Be right outside. Take your time.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, my God. Oh, my God.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We are so rich.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Are you kidding me?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, Jerry, the one who got away. May I ask why you're leaving the Michael Scott Paper Company? Really? Please hold. [gets up and runs to kitchen] Charles.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: May I have your attention? The Michael Scott Paper Company is broke.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: What? How'd you hear that?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: They've been calling all of their clients and begging them to pay more money. That can only mean one thing. They're desperate. Which can only mean one thing. They're total failures.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Great work Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Quiet you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, I mean, great detective work. 'Cause this must be the first case you've ever cracked, right?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You don't crack a case. That has pejorative connotation. That's like calling a policeman a cop. You solve a case, and yes, I've solved plenty.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: So how long can they stay viable?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What are your top five cases?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm gonna answer Charles first.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Because you've solved zero cases.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, one. Case of the beet bandit. Missing beets from all over the farm. No footprints. Inside job. Mose in socks. Boom, case closed.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Okay, do not go anywhere near the conference room.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Done.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Because you have embarrassed me for the last time today. Got it?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm not- I'm not following you.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: You two are morons.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Got it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wh-

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Get out.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: So you've thought it over, yes, and you accept our offer. We can finally put this whole thing behind us? Hmm?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Can you give us another minute please?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Oh, okay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: How could you do this to me, Michael? You just cost me $60,000.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Why are you assuming you'd get the whole thing?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's a lot of money, okay. But we need money coming in every week. We need jobs. Wouldn't you rather have a fishing pole than a fish?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I would rather have $60,000, honestly.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, Michael's right. Jobs are safer.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Agreed?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Agreed. But that's all, okay.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah, discuss these things-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Shut up, shut up. Hello?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I want my old job back. I want my old parking space back. I want a Sebring.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: They don't make them anymore.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And I want Charles gone.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: I am not firing Charles. He is very valuable.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: That's very kind of you to say, David.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I need him gone.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, then I want Pam back.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Uh, you already have a new receptionist-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Sales.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Pam's not a salesperson.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, she is. At the Michael Scott Paper Company in it's heyday.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That's right.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Okay. Please continue.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And Ryan.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Ryan cost Dunder Mifflin hundreds of thousands of dollars, Michael. Ryan is-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know, David. I don't care if Ryan murdered his entire family he is like a son to me.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Do you realize what you're asking for here? You're talking about salary plus health benefits-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And dental this time.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Insurance, taxes, social security for three people. This is a heck of a lot more than 60 grand. You're talking about a multi-million dollar buy-out.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: These are our demands.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Your company cannot be worth that much.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Our company is worth nothing. That's the difference between you and I. Business isn't about money to me, David. If tomorrow my company goes under, I will just start another paper company. And then another and another and another. I have no shortage of company names.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Michael-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's one of 'em! Yes. These are our demands. This is what we want. Our balls are in your court.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Okay. Deal. Okay?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Can we have the room please?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Yeah. [David and Charles leave room, Michael shuts the door and closes the blinds]

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yes, yes, yes!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Alright!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes! Can you believe it? That's what I'm talking about!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: There are certain defining moments in a person's life. The day he is born. The day he grows hair. The day he starts a business. And the day he sells that business back to Dunder Mifflin. What have I learned from all of this? It is far too early to tell. I just know that I am flying high and I don't even want to think about it. I just want to enjoy it.

Quote.Speaker: Charles
Quote.Text: Hey, guys-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no. You're done.
